shortDescription.text: CVE-2019-20477: Deserialization of Untrusted Data in PyYAML

fullDescription.text: PyYAML 5.1 through 5.1.2 has insufficient restrictions on the load and load_all functions because of a class deserialization issue, e.g., Popen is a class in the subprocess module. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-18342.
fullDescription.markdown: PyYAML 5.1 through 5.1.2 has insufficient restrictions on the load and load_all functions because of a class deserialization issue, e.g., Popen is a class in the subprocess module. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-18342.

help.text:
**Your dependency is vulnerable to [CVE-2019-20477](https://osv.dev/list?q=CVE-2019-20477)**
(Also published as: [PYSEC-2020-176](https://osv.dev/vulnerability/PYSEC-2020-176), [GHSA-3pqx-4fqf-j49f](https://osv.dev/vulnerability/GHSA-3pqx-4fqf-j49f), ).

## [PYSEC-2020-176](https://osv.dev/vulnerability/PYSEC-2020-176)

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

> PyYAML 5.1 through 5.1.2 has insufficient restrictions on the load and load_all functions because of a class deserialization issue, e.g., Popen is a class in the subprocess module. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-18342.

</details>

## [GHSA-3pqx-4fqf-j49f](https://osv.dev/vulnerability/GHSA-3pqx-4fqf-j49f)

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

> PyYAML 5.1 through 5.1.2 has insufficient restrictions on the load and load_all functions because of a class deserialization issue, e.g., Popen is a class in the subprocess module. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2017-18342.

</details>

---

### Affected Packages

| Source | Package Name | Package Version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| lockfile:/home/sg/Projects/smithy_security/smithy/tmp/requirements.txt | pyyaml | 5.1.2 |

## Remediation

To fix these vulnerabilities, update the vulnerabilities past the listed fixed versions below.

### Fixed Versions

| Vulnerability ID | Package Name | Fixed Version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| GHSA-3pqx-4fqf-j49f | pyyaml | 5.2 |
| PYSEC-2020-176 | pyyaml | 5.2b1 |

shortDescription.text: CVE-2020-1747: Improper Input Validation in PyYAML

fullDescription.text: A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions before 5.3.1, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the python/object/new constructor.
fullDescription.markdown: A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions before 5.3.1, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the python/object/new constructor.

## [PYSEC-2020-96](https://osv.dev/vulnerability/PYSEC-2020-96)

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

> A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions before 5.3.1, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. An attacker could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the python/object/new constructor.

</details>

shortDescription.text: CVE-2020-14343: Improper Input Validation in PyYAML

fullDescription.text: A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions before 5.4, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. This flaw allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the python/object/new constructor. This flaw is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-1747.
fullDescription.markdown: A vulnerability was discovered in the PyYAML library in versions before 5.4, where it is susceptible to arbitrary code execution when it processes untrusted YAML files through the full_load method or with the FullLoader loader. Applications that use the library to process untrusted input may be vulnerable to this flaw. This flaw allows an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system by abusing the python/object/new constructor. This flaw is due to an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-1747.
